content_raw:
to move from its current configuration to a goal configuration. - 3D Perception: Using sensor data to build a representation of the environment for collision avoidance.

Why is Inverse Kinematics considered a "hard" problem compared to Forward Kinematics?

Work through the MoveIt tutorials. Launch the MoveIt setup for a demo robot arm in RViz. Use the interactive markers to drag the end-effector to a new pose and visualize the planned trajectory.

You now understand the fundamental concepts behind controlling robot arms and manipulators. You are ready to start building applications that can interact with the world in a more sophisticated way.
  • Explain what the 'end-effector' of a robot arm is.
  • Describe why the IK problem can have multiple solutions.
  • Use MoveIt to plan and execute a simple trajectory for a robot arm in RViz.
